name: Dublin Community Environmental Network
goal:
DCENs aims

To engage people within communities to make a difference on the ground, while providing knowledge and experience to make further change on government level.

To create a city that provides a healthy environment for humans, plants and animals, contains a vibrant eco-system, and that will guide and inspire other areas in Ireland.

To sustain a network of existing individuals and groups who share this vision.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Audiovisual and Media, Budget, Climate Action, Communication, Competition, Consumer Affairs, Culture, Customs, Development, Education, Energy, Environment, External Relations, Fisheries and Aquaculture, Food Safety, Home Affairs, Humanitarian Aid, Information Society, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and Technology, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport, Youth
euInitiatives:
Marine Strategy Framework Directive (2008/56/EC)
The Environmental Impact Assessment Directive
